docs.abstract: At least 28 pro-government forces and one civilian were killed in Afghanistan during the past week.
docs.snippet: At least 28 pro-government forces and one civilian were killed in Afghanistan during the past week.
docs.lead_paragraph: At least 28 pro-government forces and one civilian were killed in Afghanistan during the past week, in the quietest week of attacks since The Times began counting casualties in September 2018. The deadliest attack took place in Ghazni Province, when an airstrike mistakenly targeted an outpost of pro-government militia members, killing nine and wounding three others. It was not clear that the airstrike was carried out by Afghan or American air power.

docs.abstract: “What happened to me?” the senator asks. “Not a damn thing.”
docs.snippet: “What happened to me?” the senator asks. “Not a damn thing.”
docs.lead_paragraph: As the luncheon dishes were placed down, the master of ceremonies kicked off a boisterous round of Lindsey Graham trivia. “What is the senator’s middle name?” she asked the ballroom of meatloaf-eating Republicans in Greenville, S.C. “What’s the name of the bar the senator’s family owned?”

headline.main: How Lindsey Graham Went From Trump Skeptic to Trump Sidekick
headline.print_headline: ‘What Happened to Me? Not a Damn Thing’

docs.abstract: The magazine’s Ethicist columnist on managing the monetary demands of impecunious relatives, a tax-dodging boss and more.
docs.snippet: The magazine’s Ethicist columnist on managing the monetary demands of impecunious relatives, a tax-dodging boss and more.
docs.lead_paragraph: My family splits into two camps: people who have money and people who don’t. We didn’t start in different places; we evolved into them. My father, my brother and I are savers and planners. My sister, my aunt and my mother received the same inheritances, the same educational opportunities and the same career options, but they have spent everything they have and more. My mother and sister each filed for bankruptcy (my mother passed away with more than $1 million in debt).

headline.main: Can I Turn Down Family Requests for Money?
headline.print_headline: How Should I Deal With Family Requests for Money?

docs.abstract: She was in therapy for a death in her family. Most of her doctors thought her vision problem was stress related — except one.
docs.snippet: She was in therapy for a death in her family. Most of her doctors thought her vision problem was stress related — except one.
docs.lead_paragraph: “You look awful,” Esther Sarid, a psychiatrist in Toronto, told her patient. She’d been seeing the 46-year-old woman for nearly a year, after the sudden death of her brother. Despite her grief, the patient continued to work hard as a professor at a Canadian university. But Sarid knew it had been a tough time for her.

headline.main: Why Was the Woman Having Trouble Seeing, if Her Eyes Were Fine?
headline.print_headline: Why Was the Woman Having Trouble Seeing, if Her Eyes Were Fine?

docs.abstract: The actor on Barry Jenkins, Susanne Bier and whether actors of color should make more socially progressive films.
docs.snippet: The actor on Barry Jenkins, Susanne Bier and whether actors of color should make more socially progressive films.
docs.lead_paragraph: People know you for starring in “Moonlight” in 2016, but before you became an actor, you were on your way to becoming a track-and-field star until you suffered an injury. What’s harder: running with a torn A.C.L. or starring in a small indie film about a queer black love story? Running with a torn A.C.L., 100 percent. The most physically painful thing I’ve ever experienced.

headline.main: Trevante Rhodes Wants to Challenge How Hollywood Portrays Black Men
headline.print_headline: Trevante Rhodes Wants to Challenge Hollywood

docs.abstract: Conflicts, corruption, Russian influence and politicizing government are just some of the areas of inquiry they have proposed.
docs.snippet: Conflicts, corruption, Russian influence and politicizing government are just some of the areas of inquiry they have proposed.
docs.lead_paragraph: In two weeks, congressional Democrats will return to Washington with the authority to investigate a White House that is suspected of foreign collusion, conflicts of interest and mismanagement of the federal government.  Jason Zengerle wrote an article about three Democratic representatives who will become chairmen of committees with powerful investigative mandates. These are some potential areas of inquiry proposed in 2017 and 2018 by House Democrats on those committees:

headline.main: In an Administration Full of Investigative Targets, Where Would the Democrats Start?
